title: Sample Book, late 18th–early 19th century
medium:
Medium: leather, paper, wool, cotton
Technique: warp-faced plain weave with supplementary warp patterning
inscribed: Tooled on front cover "T. Th. Clerc fils & Cie. de Paris"
description: Salesman's sample book of 285 small samples of wool and cotton, mounted on paper and bound in gold-tooled green leather book. Many samples have the appearance of duvetyn, a soft woolen fabric with a downy nap that was used for waistcoats.

exhibitions.title: Multiple Choice: From Sample to Product

tombstone.epitaph:
Sample Book, late 18th–early 19th century.
late 18th–early 19th century. Medium: leather, paper, wool, cotton
Technique: warp-faced plain weave with supplementary warp patterning. Gift of Mrs. Montgomery  Hare. 1936-29-4.
